main event: On May 24, 1954, an Air Force Major flying a photographic mapping mission near Richmond, Indiana, observed and photographed a large, high-intensity light moving below his aircraft.
interesting points: The light traveled a distance of six miles at a speed twice that of the aircraft., Intensive studies concluded the light was not a material object., Extensive investigations yielded negative results regarding other possible explanations., A panel of specialists determined the phenomenon was caused by the reflection of sun rays on ice-crystal formations., The case involved a Major with a reliable observation record.
witness description: Air Force Major flying a photographic mapping mission
